titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. A. J. Warden, Indictment
CWG5152

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Ballard Circuit Court
Commonwealth of Ky
against
A J Warren Dft } Shooting with intent to kill

The Grand Jury of Ballard County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse A J Wardin of the Crime of unlawfully shooting at without wounding another with the intent to wound and kill such another: Committed as follows to wit. The said A J Wardin on the 25th day of September 1865. in County afd did with a pistol loaded with powder and a leaden ball, or other hard substances unlawfully shoot at without wounding Samuel A Seay, with the intent him the said S A Seay to wound and kill, against the Peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Ky

W W Tice
Atty for the Comth

Endorsement
Filed act the 4th 1865
AJ Wardin clk

Copy attest
A J. Wardin clk
Copy of Indictment
"A"
